verses.kjv: And the men of Kirjathjearim came, and fetched up the ark of the LORD, and brought it into the house of Abinadab in the hill, and sanctified Eleazar his son to keep the ark of the LORD.
verses.ct: So the men of Kirjathjearim came and took the ark of the LORD back with them. They brought it to the house of Abinadab on the hill and set apart his son Eleazar to be responsible for guarding the ark of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, while the ark abode in Kirjathjearim, that the time was long; for it was twenty years: and all the house of Israel lamented after the LORD.
verses.ct: The ark stayed in Kirjathjearim for a long time — 20 years in all. During that period, all of Israel mourned and longed for the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Samuel spake unto all the house of Israel, saying, If ye do return unto the LORD with all your hearts, then put away the strange gods and Ashtaroth from among you, and prepare your hearts unto the LORD, and serve him only: and he will deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.ct: Samuel spoke to all the people of Israel and said, "If you are truly returning to the LORD with all your hearts, then get rid of the foreign gods and the images of Ashtaroth from among you. Commit yourselves fully to the LORD and serve him alone, and he will rescue you from the power of the Philistines."

verses.kjv: Then the children of Israel did put away Baalim and Ashtaroth, and served the LORD only.
verses.ct: So the Israelites removed the images of Baal and Ashtaroth and served the LORD alone.

verses.kjv: And Samuel said, Gather all Israel to Mizpeh, and I will pray for you unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Then Samuel said, "Bring all of Israel together at Mizpeh, and I will pray to the LORD on your behalf."

verses.kjv: And they gathered together to Mizpeh, and drew water, and poured it out before the LORD, and fasted on that day, and said there, We have sinned against the LORD. And Samuel judged the children of Israel in Mizpeh.
verses.ct: They assembled at Mizpeh, drew water, and poured it out in the LORD's presence. They fasted that day and declared, "We have sinned against the LORD." Samuel served as judge over the Israelites at Mizpeh.

verses.kjv: And when the Philistines heard that the children of Israel were gathered together to Mizpeh, the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel. And when the children of Israel heard it, they were afraid of the Philistines.
verses.ct: When the Philistines learned that the Israelites had gathered at Mizpeh, the Philistine rulers marched up to attack Israel. When the Israelites heard about this, they were terrified of the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel said to Samuel, Cease not to cry unto the LORD our God for us, that he will save us out of the hand of the Philistines.
verses.ct: The Israelites pleaded with Samuel, "Don't stop calling out to the LORD our God for us! Ask him to save us from the power of the Philistines!"

verses.kjv: And Samuel took a sucking lamb, and offered it for a burnt offering wholly unto the LORD: and Samuel cried unto the LORD for Israel; and the LORD heard him.
verses.ct: Samuel took a young nursing lamb and offered it as a complete burnt offering to the LORD. He cried out to the LORD on Israel's behalf, and the LORD answered him.

verses.kjv: And as Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel: but the LORD thundered with a great thunder on that day upon the Philistines, and discomfited them; and they were smitten before Israel.
verses.ct: While Samuel was presenting the burnt offering, the Philistines advanced to attack Israel. But that day the LORD sent a tremendous thunderstorm against the Philistines and threw them into such confusion that they were defeated by Israel.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel went out of Mizpeh, and pursued the Philistines, and smote them, until they came under Bethcar.
verses.ct: The men of Israel charged out from Mizpeh, chased the Philistines, and struck them down all the way to a point below Bethcar.

verses.kjv: Then Samuel took a stone, and set it between Mizpeh and Shen, and called the name of it Ebenezer, saying, Hitherto hath the LORD helped us.
verses.ct: After this, Samuel took a stone and placed it between Mizpeh and Shen. He named it Ebenezer, saying, "Up to this point, the LORD has helped us."

verses.kjv: So the Philistines were subdued, and they came no more into the coast of Israel: and the hand of the LORD was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel.
verses.ct: The Philistines were brought low and did not invade Israelite territory again. The LORD's power worked against the Philistines throughout Samuel's entire lifetime.

verses.kjv: And the cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel, from Ekron even unto Gath; and the coasts thereof did Israel deliver out of the hands of the Philistines. And there was peace between Israel and the Amorites.
verses.ct: The towns that the Philistines had captured from Israel were returned — everything from Ekron to Gath — and Israel reclaimed the surrounding territory from Philistine control. There was also peace between Israel and the Amorites.

verses.kjv: And Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.
verses.ct: Samuel served as judge over Israel for the rest of his life.

verses.kjv: And he went from year to year in circuit to Bethel, and Gilgal, and Mizpeh, and judged Israel in all those places.
verses.ct: Every year he traveled a circuit through Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpeh, settling disputes and leading Israel in each of those places.

verses.kjv: And his return was to Ramah; for there was his house; and there he judged Israel; and there he built an altar unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Then he would return home to Ramah, where he lived. He judged Israel from there as well, and he built an altar to the LORD in that place.
